newsitem.title: USA: Oracle shares fall after Goldman report.
newsitem.headline: Oracle shares fall after Goldman report.

text.p: Oracle Corp shares fell in heavy trading Monday after a closely watched software analyst at Goldman, Sachs & Co suggested the stock is unlikely to gain until March.

"We believe Oracle's stock is stuck in 'no man's land' until it reports results for the third fiscal quarter" ending February, said analyst Rick Sherlund in a research report released Monday. "It will likely take some encouraging news on European operations for the stock to perform and investor apprehensions grow as the quarter progresses."
Oracle shares fell 1-1/2 to 38-1/8 on Nasdaq trading of 13.3 million shares, making the stock the second-most active in U.S. markets.

Oracle, the largest publisher of database software, blamed lower-than-expected earnings in its fiscal second quarter ended November on weak sales in Europe. Sherlund said investors will be wary of Oracle's stock until it can report good news on its efforts to revamp its European operations.
Sherlund did not change his stock rating or earnings estimate for the quarter on the Redwood Shores, Calif.-based company.
